introduction: A Geotechnical Engineering virtual lab is a digital platform that allows students to conduct experiments related to Geotechnical Engineering concepts in a visual and comprehensive manner. It is a self-paced learning tool that helps students to understand fundamental concepts and prepare for physical experiments in a safe and controlled environment.

experiments.name: Determination of particle size distribution(finer than 75 micron) using density Hydrometer
Determination of dry density by Sand Replacement method
Determination of Insitu density by Core cutter method
Determination of Liquid limit and Plastic limit for cohesive soils
Determination of Shrinkage limit for cohesive soils
Determination of MDD & OMC by Standard Proctor test
Determination of Coefficient of Consolidation by Oedometer test
Determination of Uniaxial Compression Strength of soil by unconfined compression test
Determination of undrained shear strength of soil by Vane Shear test
Determination of Coefficient of Permeability of Soil by Constant Head Permeability test

UG: BE / B. Tech in Civil Engineering / Geological Engineering
PG: MTech / MS in Geotechnical engineering or Foundation engineering or Soil Mechanics

objective: The Geotechnical Engineering virtual lab aims to provide students with a comprehensive and visual platform to conduct experiments and gain a better understanding of fundamental concepts. It is not intended to replace physical lab experiments but to supplement them. The virtual lab offers a controlled environment that minimizes risks and optimizes resources. Overall, it is an effective pedagogical tool that equips students with the necessary skills to conduct physical experiments confidently and proficiently.

universities: Applied soil Engineering - National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal
Basic Geotechnical Engineering - Visvesvaraya Technological University
Geotechnical Engineering Laboratory - Visvesvaraya Technological University
Soil Mechanics and Foundation Engineering - Vellore Institute of Technology
Advanced Soil Mechanics - Vellore Institute of Technology
Soil Mechanics and Engineering Geology - IIT Roorkee
